climbs.name: Rama-Lama-Ding Dong
climbs.fa: Mike Strassman and Jackie Carroll Late 1990s.

content.description: This route is on the East side of Elephant Rock. Starting on the face left of the crack/chimney, climb face on nice rock and pull an overhang.
content.location: On the East side of Elephant Rock. To the left of the crack/chimney.

climbs.name: My Pink Elephant Has Become My White Elephant

content.description: Inside route on right side of Elephant Rock.  Route starts in a wide chimney.  Chimney may be utilized around second/third bolt but probably downgrades route.  Crux is around second bolt.  Once through the crux is 5.9/10a to the top.
content.location: Right side of Elephant Rock, up the hill and across from Leaning Tower of Pizza

content.description: Fun route easy to find as with most routes in the Alabama Hills.  Route starts with tricky slab and climbs to a second bolt crux.  Climb would be much more difficult without the bullet hole holds.  Once above the slight bulge the route becomes a bit easier to the anchor.
content.location: Elephant rock to the right of Rama-lama-ding-dong on the front face.  Probably the first route you see when approaching down steep hill.
